Generation I.Red: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it is caught.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it is caught.
Generation I.Yellow: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.
Generation I.Stadium: When enraged, it gives chase endlessly. Because it is impossible to tell what made it angry, there is no soothing it.

Generation II.Gold: If approached while asleep, it may awaken and angrily give chase in a groggy state of semi-sleep.
Generation II.Silver: It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.
Generation II.Crystal: It will beat up anyone who makes it mad, even if it has to chase them until the end of the world.
Generation II.Stadium 2: If approached while asleep, it may awaken and angrily give chase in a groggy state of semi-sleep. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation is boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger. However, it also becomes much less intelligent at the same time.
Generation III.Sapphire: When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation is boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger. However, it also becomes much less intelligent at the same time.
Generation III.Emerald: When it becomes furious, its blood circulation becomes more robust, and its muscles are made stronger. But it also becomes much less intelligent.
Generation III.FireRed: It is always outrageously furious. If it gives chase, it will tenaciously track the target no matter how far.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it catches up.

Generation IV.Diamond: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.
Generation IV.Pearl: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.
Generation IV.Platinum: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.
Generation IV.HeartGold: If approached while asleep, it may awaken and angrily give chase in a groggy state of semi-sleep.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.

Generation V.Black: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.
Generation V.White: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.
Generation V.Black 2: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.
Generation V.White 2: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.

Generation VI.X: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.
Generation VI.Y: It is always outrageously furious. If it gives chase, it will tenaciously track the target no matter how far.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation is boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger. However, it also becomes much less intelligent at the same time.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation is boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger. However, it also becomes much less intelligent at the same time.

Generation VII.Sun: It has been known to become so angry that it dies as a result. Its face looks peaceful in death, however.
Generation VII.Moon: Some researchers theorize that Primeape remains angry even when inside a Poké Ball.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It will never forgive opponents who have angered it. Even after it has beaten them down until they can't move, it never ever forgives.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: The blood vessels in its brain are sturdier than those of other Pokémon, so it can stay healthy despite its constant raging.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It becomes angry if it sees an opponent's eyes and gets angrier if the opponent runs. Even after it beats the opponent, it is still angry.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It becomes angry if it sees an opponent's eyes and gets angrier if the opponent runs. Even after it beats the opponent, it is still angry.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.
Generation IX.Violet: Some researchers theorize that Primeape remains angry even when inside a Poké Ball.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Routes 225 and 226 ( Poké Radar ) Grand Underground - Spacious Cave , Grassland Cave , Sunlit Cavern (After obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Routes 225 and 226 ( Poké Radar ) Grand Underground - Spacious Cave , Grassland Cave , Sunlit Cavern (After obtaining the National Pokédex )
